description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f797b","text":"This protocol describes a high throughput extraction method to isolate genomic DNA for screening clones (e.g. from 24 well plate).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h0rk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cdvi","text":"There are two options: i) you can split clones onto two plates and extract gDNA from one of those replica plates, or ii) during the process of splitting cells, you can keep some material for genotyping. This protocol describes the second option.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51qnl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffv4j","text":"This protocol is for hESCs, but could work for other cell-types too.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b203u","text":"Grow clones on a multi-well format, e.g. 24-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ptl0","text":"Prepare new matrigel coated plates for passaging clones and label PCR strip tubes corresponding to the position of the clones on the plates. E.g. 1-A1 would refer to plate 1, position A1 on the plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"crkva","text":"When clones are ready to be split, remove media and add ReLeSR for  . Aspirate ReLeSR and leave in incubator for   until colonies appear cracked.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":56,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":79,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":113,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7fv2h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"30D90AF0AA0D11EC97FE0745BEA6C208","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":180,"guid":"35130B20AA0D11EC97FE0745BEA6C208","id":0,"label":"(up to 5 minutes)","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5fori","text":"Add appropriate amount of warmed mTeSR1 media for splitting, and tap plate gently. Using a P1000, gently scratch well to release remaining cells and put half media/cells in PCR tube and half in new plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4hadf","text":"In the meantime, prepare new plate by removing matrigel and adding some warmed mTeSR1  media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":47,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":79,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5g44m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ij3h","text":"Tap new plate to distribute cells and return to incubator. Monitor the following day and replace media (may see a lot of death).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7uvl1","text":"Pulse spin strip tubes on bench-top mini-centrifuge. You may see pellet of cells. Remove media and replace with    QuickExtract buffer. Tap to dislodge pellet. Could pipette up and down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":115,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":112,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"26vne","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"EDEF1C10AA0D11EC97FE0745BEA6C208","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dbfn5","text":"Place in thermocycler with the following settings:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30sv5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1brh7","text":"65°C 8-10 min ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d14ks","text":"98°C 10 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bsdaj","text":"DNA samples are now ready to be used for PCR genotyping. For example, first try 1uL sample in a 10uL reaction (e.g. GXL PrimeStar - or Q5 polymerase). If PCR fails, try a dilution 1:5 of DNA, then 1:25 dilution etc.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
